intro: Streptocarpus acicularis, commonly known as the needle streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a cool, humid environment. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers are usually violet or blue in color and attract various pollinators.
